Two words: forgotten and underrated.

Day of Defeat: Source is the best example of a simple yet mostly accurate WW2 shooter simulator. The game perfectly captures WW2 fighting but with a more fast paced arena feel. If you enjoy WW2 shooters but wish they were more simple this game is certainly for you, I myself prefer it over original DoD. The game does have some issues though.. This game never got much attention even after its release, it still has some bugs in it but they aren't major, it also isn't too popular either, it only has about 370 active servers and about 70 are private ones, this game is old and is played by middle aged men who have been playing since 2005 or the 90's. As they have been playing for so long they're all masters which slightly ruins it. If you join a server you will probably find middle aged men talking about alcohol and their marriage. One other great thing about the simplicity is its tiny learning curve. All you really need to play this game is quick thinking and good aim. If you like fast paced and featurefull arena type shooters you will like this game. Fantastic.

It's a fun arcade game for a while. After 13 hours I have played I've had enough and will never come back to it, but it hits such a low price on sales that you might get it just to play for a few days if you're looking for an arcade PvP shooter. However, there are better games so might as well skip it.

DODS je podle mě jedna z nejlepších válečných online her. Produkt od Valve v podstatě nezklame a dá hráči to co od toho čeká. Tahle hra není určitě pro všechny, není to žádný call of duty takže je na místě si před nákupem uvědomit že hra je celkem těžká a bude trvat než se jí naučíte. Na to jak je ta hra stará vypadá furt dobře a dobře se chová bez nějakých bugů atp. Každý kdo rád střílí a je fanoušek 2 sv. by si to měl koupit kor za tu cenu která je fakt nízká. Hráčů to hraje i po 15 letech celkem dost a ta komunita okolo té hry není vůbec slabá. 

+ grafika
+ je to těžký a na dlouho
+ dobrá optimalizace 
+ zábava i po tolika letech je furt dost serverů a hráčů 

- asi nic co bych vyčetl krom toho že to může být po čase pro někoho stereotypní

A dream come true: I get to kill Nazis.

Day of Defeat: Source is quite an old game, but it is still unbelievably great.

This game is a fully realized replacement for Day of Defeat and it is one of the better WWII shooter games out there. As a player of the original DoD, this game has come quite a long way and was even made better thanks to the Source engine.

It has beautiful maps with fully rendered sounds and sights. Most of the basic maps were remakes of the original game, but they are more detailed and balanced than the original maps. Also, a lot of additional maps were released since the game came out. There are still loads of servers to play on and they continue to be supported by players.

The gameplay is more fast paced, realistic, and of course more visually stunning than the original DoD. 

Day of Defeat: Source  is well worth its price. Try it out, you won't be disappointed.

Basically a WW2 Counter-Strike
An old gem with a more tactical approach to the fps genre. In fact, you must control your shooting if you want to hit something even at a short distance.
It's settled in 1944 and you can play as the Allies or the Germans, each team featuring unique weapons. There are six different classes, from the rifleman to the rocket launcher.
Is it still alive? Yes! After all these years there are still many servers full of players.
o for awesome, been around for years. o for awesome. chur.

Łącząc II Wojnę Światową z „Szeregowcem Ryanem” (dlaczego napisze zaraz) i Team Fortressem 2 wychodzi nam tytuł Day of Defeat: Source. 

Napisać coś złego o tej grze to jak strzelić sobie w kolano, swoją rozgrywkę w DoD:S rozpocząłem w 2019 roku. Czytając recenzje kierowałem się głównie tym, że nie ma rusków i cheaterów (po tym chyba każdy może wywnioskować w co grałem, teraz już w to nie gram). Spotkałem naprawdę fajną społeczność, społeczność zarówno śmieszną, jak i naprawdę dobrą. Poznałem wielu znajomych, niestety tylko niewielka cząstka z nich to są Polacy. O dziwo w tą grę nie gra za wielu naszych rodaków, może to lepiej. Nie ma pewnego „toksycznego” jadu podczas rozgrywki. 

Jeżeli już o rozgrywce mowa, jest kilka trybów rozgrywki - od przejmowania punktów, po podkładanie/rozbrajanie bomb na celach. Niektóre serwery oferują również rozgrywkę w trybie „Realism”. Polega on na tym, że dwóch liderów drużyn wybiera swoich kompanów. Po wybraniu zespołów zaczyna się rozgrywka. Przeprowadzone zostają 4 mecze na jednej mapie (2 mecze po każdej stronie konfliktu, każdy 1 mecz to odpowiednio atak/defensywa). Wygrywa ta drużyna, która osiągnie wynik 3 wygranych potyczek, jeżeli dojdzie do remisu, to jest rozgrywana 5 runda, która polega na graniu klasą z karabinem automatycznym StG44 zarazem nie kampiąc. Taki tryb zauważyłem tylko na serwerze 3te Panzer Grenadier Division.

Społeczność jak wspomniałem wcześniej jest świetna. Myślę, że przez szeroki wachlarz drużyn i zespołów głównie skupiających się na aspektach historycznych trafi do wszystkich zainteresowanych II Wojną Światową osób. Osobiście polecam niemiecką grupę 3te Panzer Grenadier Division (3te PGD). 

Wydaje mi się, że porównanie „Szeregowca Ryana” do tej gry jest jak najbardziej trafne. Gra jest stylizowana na okres lądowania Amerykanów we Włoszech, w Normandii. Można to zauważyć po szacie, którymi zdobione są mapy. Nazewnictwo map również nawiązuje do nazw francuskich, tj. Colmar, Avalanche, czy też do nazw włoskich, tj. Anzio.

Podsumowując - śmiało mogę stwierdzić, że pomimo swojego niemłodego wieku gra NADAL cieszy się sporą popularnością, szczególnie w krajach zachodnich. Dla osób lubiących TF2 oraz klimat WW2, a chcących odpocząć czy tez poddać się abstynencji od CS’a jest to pozycja obowiązkowa! :)

CoD ve Battlefield gibi hissetmeseniz de (ki amaçlanan şey savaş ortamı değil) iyi kötü savaş ortamında hissediyorsunuz.Grafikler zamanına göre iyi.Oynanışa gelince artılı ekşili birçok yönü var.Mauser Kar98k ve M1 Garand gibi silahları dürbünsüz olarak aşırı kolay.O kadar kolay ki bu silahları oynayamamanız için kolsuz olmanız lazım.Kar98K'nın dürbünlüsü ve Springfield için çok bir şey diyemem o kadar deneyimlemedim.Bar ve STG44'e gelince.Elimizde tüfek var şahı topu değil.Ne bu geri tepme?Ne bu recoil?Çok abartılı bir geri tepmesi var.MP40 ve Thompson başarılı olmuş diyebilirim.Pistoller de keza olması gerektiği gibi.Eksik olarak Panzerfäust oyunda yok ama yerine Panzerschreck var o da olur.Maplar güzel Palermo ve Avalanche favorim.Şu 32 kişilik server'lar... Yiğidin harman olduğu yer.Adım atıyorsun nereden geldi o mermi?İki adım daha atıyorsun o bomba nereden çıktı?Alışmak zor oluyor bunlara hele o bordo bereli abilerimiz varken.
Sistemimim düşük oynayacak oyun lazım dersen şiddetle öneririm.
İndirimde almanız daha yararınıza olur.
Bu arada Gabe abi bu oyunun remake ini yapmasak mı?

This title is honestly one of the better WWII shooter games I've had the pleasure of playing. Even though the game is nearing 15 years old, its gameplay still holds up today. The graphics, eh, not too much, but they are good for 2005 technology.

I really like how the class system is set up, with examples such as being a regular infantryman, a sniper, or a support gunner. This variety really can be useful when figuring out your playstyle - you can be a nervous wreck of a private or an insane lunatic with a machine gun.

Some of the mechanics (most notably, aiming down sights) do tend to be a bit wonky - furthermore, the speed at which you move when scoped in with the Sniper Rifle (Kar98k or Springfield) is ridiculously low: I'm aware that it's probably a balancing feature, but it still is hard to work with. 

But what I really think shines through is the communication that you see in most Valve multiplayers. I especially like the audio callouts you can do, where your soldier will shout it out after pressing the key. It's certainly a useful feature. 

At the end of the day, though, the core gameplay, capturing objectives, and getting some frags are what makes this game worth it.

"Day of Defeat: Source" ist ein Online Mehrspieler First-Person Shooter aus dem Jahre 2010.

Es handelt sich bei dem Titel eigentlich nur um eine Portierung des Originals "Day of Defeat" aus dem Jahre 2003 in die Source-Engine. Der Shooter war eigentlich - wie Counter-Strike - eine "Half Life" Mod, von Fans erstellt und dann von Valve verbessert und gepublished. 

Wir sind im Zweiten Weltkrieg und spielen entweder auf Seiten der Alliierten oder der Achsenmächte. Wir suchen uns eine Klasse aus - vom normalen Infanteristen über den MG Schützen bis zum Scharfschützen und Kommandanten ist alles notwendige vorhanden - und kämpfen auf verschiedenen Maps darum, die Oberhand zu gewinnen und Flaggen einzunehmen. 

Das Spiel ist direkt, schnörkellos und relativ schnell. Dennoch sind gute Kartenkenntnis und ein gemeinsames Vorgehen hilfreich für eine erfolgreiche Partie. Sicher ist es aber kein Hardcore-Shooter. Es geht weniger um Realismus als um das kompetitive Spielerlebnis. Und das kann der Shooter auch heute immer noch vermitteln. Es gibt auch noch Server, die besucht werden. Auch einige von Usern erstellte Karten mit eigenen Skins und Sounds. So findet man - zumindest zu den üblichen Spielzeiten - eigentlich immer eine Partie. 

Die Grafik ist natürlich - auch trotz Source Engine - nicht mehr aktuell, aber sie funktioniert noch richtig gut. Ebenso ist der Sound nach wie vor gut und auf Zweckmäßigkeit ausgelegt. Alles was wir hören, gibt uns sinnvolle Informationen über die Bewegungen der Mitspieler. Eine Partie "Day of Defeat" macht einfach Spaß und mir - das ist sicher Geschmackssache - auch mehr Spaß als "Counter Strike" und sicher mehr als eine Partie eines modernen "Battlefield" oder "Call of Duty". Denn bei "Day of Defeat" kommt es primär wirklich noch auf Skill an. Jede Klasse ist sinnvoll und hat ihre Stärken und Schwächen. Und auch als Neuling hat man dasselbe Equipment wie die Veteranen.

Day of Defeat: Source has some great, tactical gunplay which is historically accurate. Also, with a community that is still active, this game deserves to be more popular. Buy it on sale.

7.5/10

Jogo muito divertido! Prefiro ele ao CS Source, pois sou historiador e amo estudar sobre a Segunda Guerra. O servidor DTB, ativo há anos, é o melhor de todos, sem dúvidas. Está muito bem cuidado e sempre tem administrador de olho. A diversão não fica para trás: apesar do jogo estar ambientado na 2ª GM, o que o faz acontecer são os jogadores, e no server supracitado isso não está ausente em momento algum. 

  Para os novatos: adquira-o se você curte jogar jogos em primeira pessoa, se já possui experiência com jogos da Valve, sobretudo CS Source e 1.6; você não irá se decepcionar. O preço vale a pena pela diversão. Além do player não precisar estar preocupado em se divertir tendo uma mega máquina, é um jogo que oferece um ótimo custo-benefício, principalmente pelo seu tempo ativo. 

  Mas atenção: tudo o que disse foi me baseando em uma jogatina online, no multiplayer. Para partidas off, não acho que compense. Particularmente, eu jogo pela diversão, pela oportunidade de me reunir com a galera, que acaba sendo querida pelo tempo presente em nossas partidas.

Abandoned and unbalanced.
I'm sorry, DoD.

[h1]Como o original um excelente fps, mas sofre com os mesmos problemas.[/h1]
[i]Lembro de jogar em 2010, e desda quela época o jogo não tinha o suporte da valve, e hoje em dia quase 12 anos depois o jogo continua assim, parece até uma maldição, sendo bizarro ou não todos os jogos da valve tem o mesmo destino.(Ser abandonado pela empresa e os servers cheios de download lists)
Tirando isso ainda acho um game excelente, bem pelo menos melhor que os ultimos cods e bfs, com boas game mecanics, replayability e dependendo do servers boas comunidades(especialmente nos servers dos eua), recomendo mas acredito que você vai joga uma vez e depois esquecer dele.[/i]
